wikipedia_page.main:
Percy Holman (5 April 1891 – 9 June 1978) was a British Labour and Co-operative politician.
Holman was educated at Mill Hill School and the London School of Economics. As e conscientious objector, he served in World War I with the Friends' Ambulance Unit and Red Cross in France, 1915–18. He took up a career as a paper merchant.
Holman was a councillor on Middlesex County Council 1928-31 and Teddington Urban District Council 1928–34. He stood as a candidate in Twickenham four times, at the 1931 general election, by-elections in 1932 and 1934 and the 1935 general election, without success. He was elected Member of Parliament for South West Bethnal Green in 1945 and for the redrawn Bethnal Green in 1950, serving until 1966.
Married 10.5.1918 to Dorothy Mary Anderson (an Australian) who was a Labour member of the London County Council for twenty years. They had two daughters and a son.

response: At the 1945 election, all 11 LCS-sponsored candidates were elected, including Dan Chater in Bethnal Green North East, Percy Holman in Bethnal Green South West and C.S.Ganley in Battersea South. Alfred Barnes, also elected for East Ham South, even became a Cabinet Minister in the Attlee administration after 1945.
* Percy Holman, Bethnal Green South-West, 1945–1950; Bethnal Green, 1950–1966

link_mentions.page: Bethnal Green South West (UK Parliament constituency)

response: He finally entered the Commons at the 1966 general election, succeeding Percy Holman as Member of Parliament for the safe Labour seat of Bethnal Green. In the same year, he published his second book Foes to tyranny: a history of the Amalgamated Union of Building Trade Workers.
